text: in this video you'll see how to use aws
service catalog
stack import to add governance to aws
cloud formation stacks
with this feature you can add products
to service catalog that match your
running cloud formation stacks
allowing you to bring those stacks under
service catalog control without
recreating or disturbing the underlying
resources
let's start by navigating to service
catalog
for our purposes we've already
provisioned a portfolio called aws
service catalog stack import
for security we've added an aws identity
and access management or iam
federated user as the portfolio admin
we've also added some tag options that
can be applied to products we create and
associate with this portfolio
let's create a new product
we'll upload an amazon relational
database service or amazon rds
product that includes the snapshot on
deletion feature
in this case we'll specify the admin as
the owner
for the purposes of this example we
already have a cloud formation stack
that we created without the use of
service catalog
and the admin user has access to it to
create the product we can upload the
template file
specify the url for the template or
enter the amazon resource name or arn
we'll choose the third option
let's open our cloudformation dashboard
to find and copy the arm for our rds
stack
in this case the stack we want is rds
snapshot sample 5.
let's copy the arn and then return to
service catalog and paste it in
we'll enter 1.0 as the version name and
create the product
now let's import an existing cloud
formation stack as a provisioned product
based on the service catalog rds product
we just created
a key benefit of importing cloud
formation stacks is that it leaves the
underlying resources untouched
this allows you to avoid potential
downtime and alterations to long-running
resources
to test this let's get a baseline
reading of our current cloudformation
stack prior to importing it
after the import takes place we'll
verify that no changes occurred
let's look at the outputs
we'll take note of the jdbc connection
string for later reference
next let's review the resources
we can view the metrics associated with
this database's physical id
now that we've got a baseline reading of
our metrics to use as a reference point
let's return to service catalog and
import the stack
we'll paste in the iron we copied
earlier
next we'll select the product and
version that matches the template of
this stack
in this case we'll enter a provisioned
product name rather than automatically
generating one
now that we've imported the stack we can
see that the jdbc connection string
remained the same
let's go back to the rds aws console and
verify that the metrics and the endpoint
show no changes
the metrics show that nothing has
changed because of the import let's
check the endpoint
as you can see importing the stack did
not cause the endpoint to change
this provisioned product is not
currently associated with any portfolio
in service catalog
so let's add it to the portfolio we've
already set up for that purpose
the provisioned product is now
associated with this portfolio
but it does not yet incorporate the tag
options in the portfolio
to add those we must update the product
now that the update is complete let's
take a look at the tags
as you can see all of our tags have now
propagated into this provisioned product
in addition to tags we can also use aws
service catalog app registry
to store additional contextual
information such as operational and
management metrics relevant to the
imported stack
let's call app registry from the cli
app registry allows you to create a
repository of your applications and
associated resources
you can then define and manage your
application metadata
we'll use a predefined script to display
a list of the applications
and their associated attribute groups
within app registry
next we'll run a shell script that will
associate the cloud formation stack we
imported
with the cc recommendation app that is
already an app registry
the resource has now been associated
with cc recommendation app
inheriting all the attributes for that
application
you've just seen how to use aws service
catalog stack import to add governance
to aws cloud formation stacks
you can learn more about this topic in
the description and links for this video
thanks for watching now it's your turn
to try
